messages.title: North Wales
messages.content: Jobs for young people and growth in the Welsh economy are at the heart of Welsh Labourâ€™s plans for the next term of the Assembly. While the Tories make cuts that are too deep and too fast, Labour in the Assembly will continue to invest in homes, the NHS, education and in the safety of communities across North Wales. Labour is standing up for Wales in these tough times, and your vote for any other party puts our nation's recovery at further risk.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Focusing on jobs for young people and growth in the Welsh economy, opposing Tory cuts deemed too deep and too fast.
Labour intends to continue investing in the NHS.
Investing in homes is a priority for Labour in the next term of the Assembly.
Labour plans to continue investment in education.
Labour looks to ensure the safety of communities across North Wales.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet suggests that voting for any party other than Labour could jeopardize the nation's recovery.

issues.economy: Opposing Tory cuts, indicating that they are too deep and too fast; Labour emphasizes growth in the Welsh economy.
issues.education: Labour plans to continue investment in education.
issues.health: Labour intends to continue investing in the NHS.

housing.content: Investing in homes is a priority for Labour in the next term of the Assembly.

images.caption: Image of a child looking out over a landscape in North Wales.
